name: ID.AM-1
text: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried

name: ID.AM-2
text: Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried

name: ID.AM-3
text: Organizational communication and data flows are mapped

name: ID.AM-4
text: External information systems are catalogued

name: ID.AM-5
text: Resources (e.g., hardware, devices, data, and software) are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value

name: ID.AM-6
text: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established

name: ID.BE-1
text: The organization’s role in the supply chain is identified and communicated

name: ID.BE-2
text: The organization’s place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated

name: ID.BE-3
text: Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated

name: ID.BE-4
text: Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services are established

name: ID.BE-5
text: Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established

name: ID.GV-1
text: Organizational information security policy is established

name: ID.GV-2
text: Information security roles & responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners

name: ID.GV-3
text: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed

name: ID.GV-4
text: Governance and risk management processes address cybersecurity risks

name: ID.RA-1
text: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented

name: ID.RA-2
text: Threat and vulnerability information is received from information sharing forums and sources

name: ID.RA-3
text: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented

name: ID.RA-4
text: Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified

name: ID.RA-5
text: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine risk

name: ID.RA-6
text: Risk responses are identified and prioritized

name: ID.RM-1
text: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

name: ID.RM-2
text: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed

name: ID.RM-3
text: The organization’s determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis

name: PR.AC-1
text: Identities and credentials are managed for authorized devices and users

name: PR.AC-2
text: Physical access to assets is managed and protected

name: PR.AC-3
text: Remote access is managed

name: PR.AC-4
text: Access permissions are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties

name: PR.AC-5
text: Network integrity is protected, incorporating network segregation where appropriate

name: PR.AT-1
text: All users are informed and trained

name: PR.AT-2
text: Privileged users understand roles & responsibilities

name: PR.AT-3
text: Third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) understand roles & responsibilities

name: PR.AT-4
text: Senior executives understand roles & responsibilities

name: PR.AT-5
text: Physical and information security personnel understand roles & responsibilities

name: PR.DS-1
text: Data-at-rest is protected

name: PR.DS-2
text: Data-in-transit is protected

name: PR.DS-3
text: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition

name: PR.DS-4
text: Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained

name: PR.DS-5
text: Protections against data leaks are implemented

name: PR.DS-6
text: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity

name: PR.DS-7
text: The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment

name: PR.IP-1
text: A baseline configuration of information technology/industrial control systems is created and maintained

name: PR.IP-2
text: A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems is implemented

name: PR.IP-3
text: Configuration change control processes are in place

name: PR.IP-4
text: Backups of information are conducted, maintained, and tested periodically

name: PR.IP-5
text: Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets are met

name: PR.IP-6
text: Data is destroyed according to policy

name: PR.IP-7
text: Protection processes are continuously improved

name: PR.IP-8
text: Effectiveness of protection technologies is shared with appropriate parties

name: PR.IP-9
text: Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery plans (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) are in place and managed

name: PR.IP-10
text: Response and recovery plans are tested

name: PR.IP-11
text: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices (e.g., deprovisioning, personnel screening)

name: PR.IP-12
text: Avulnerability management plan is developed and implemented

name: PR.MA-1
text: Maintenance and repair of organizational assets is performed and logged in a timely manner, with approved and controlled tools

name: PR.MA-2
text: Remote maintenance of organizational assets is approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access

name: PR.PT-1
text: Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy

name: PR.PT-2
text: Removable media is protected and its use restricted according to policy

name: PR.PT-3
text: Access to systems and assets is controlled, incorporating the principle of least functionality

name: PR.PT-4
text: Communications and control networks are protected

name: DE.AE-1
text: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed

name: DE.AE-2
text: Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods

name: DE.AE-3
text: Event data are aggregated and correlated from multiple sources and sensors

name: DE.AE-4
text: Impact of events is determined

name: DE.AE-5
text: Incident alert thresholds are established

name: DE.CM-1
text: The network ismonitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

name: DE.CM-2
text: The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

name: DE.CM-3
text: Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

name: DE.CM-4
text: Malicious code is detected

name: DE.CM-5
text: Unauthorized mobile code is detected

name: DE.CM-6
text: External service provider activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

name: DE.CM-7
text: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed

name: DE.CM-8
text: Vulnerability scans are performed

name: DE.DP-1
text: Roles and responsibilities for detection are well defined to ensure accountability

name: DE.DP-2
text: Detection activities comply with all applicable requirements

name: DE.DP-3
text: Detection processes are tested

name: DE.DP-4
text: Event detection information is communicated to appropriate parties

name: DE.DP-5
text: Detection processes are continuously improved

name: RS.RP-1
text: Response plan is executed during or after an event

name: RS.CO-1
text: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed

name: RS.CO-2
text: Events are reported consistent with established criteria

name: RS.CO-3
text: Information is shared consistent with response plans

name: RS.CO-4
text: Coordination with stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans

name: RS.CO-5
text: Voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness

name: RS.AN-1
text: Notifications from detection systems are investigated

name: RS.AN-2
text: The impact of the incident is understood

name: RS.AN-3
text: Forensics are performed

name: RS.AN-4
text: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans

name: RS.MI-1
text: Incidents are contained

name: RS.MI-2
text: Incidents are mitigated

name: RS.MI-3
text: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks

name: RS.IM-1
text: Responseplans incorporate lessons learned

name: RS.IM-2
text: Response strategies are updated

name: RC.RP-1
text: Recovery plan is executed during or after an event

name: RC.IM-1
text: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned

name: RC.IM-2
text: Recovery strategies are updated

name: RC.CO-1
text: Public relations are managed

name: RC.CO-2
text: Reputation after an event is repaired

name: RC.CO-3
text: Recovery activities are communicated to internal stakeholders and executive and management teams
